title: Moving Profile from old computer to new crashes FF
content: Hi, I want to move my FF profile(bookmarks, passwords, login in's, CC info, preferences, etc) from my old computer to my new computer. I did a quick google search and found all I have to do is it copy the Appdata/roaming/mozilla/profile directory to the new computer. I had closed FF on the old system before I copied it to a USB drive. On the new computer I installed FF. opened it, closed it, copied the file/directory to the new system. There were already to profile subdirectories present. I just added mine. Now FF crashes. I can't have both computers on at the same time so I do not think 'Sync' will work. What did I do wrong? Any help would be appreciated.

title: Various Tabs Crashing
content:
I have a user who is experiencing various tabs crashing in Firefox. So far, I've confirmed she isn't using any extensions, has only 30-40 tabs open at any given time across 2-3 windows, and is usually using about 80-85% of the physical memory at any given time.

I've reinstalled Firefox, updated the graphics driver, and Windows is fully up to date. I've just created a new profile to see if that resolves the issue.

The crash files all list "EXCEPTION_BREAKPOINT" and "out of memory" as the sanitized reason. I suspect that the problem is as simple as it sounds, but I'd like to get another set of eyes on these crash dumps that may be able to see things that I don't, or don't even know to look for.

bp-fb87fef4-27cb-4b73-9405-7c70c0250215 bp-fb603ee9-4578-4bbe-a584-f48530250215 bp-ac13fc43-6cbe-4b41-af31-b8dac0250215 bp-045d5bc5-36a3-4ba6-aaaf-7d62c0250215 bp-26545824-6d87-45b6-8498-a7c750250215 bp-53c97a56-1437-4b43-b89c-2d9020250215 bp-75f2dde9-1dc3-48e5-b983-78d160250215 bp-3c6fd78e-ca19-4b58-ac9e-c29640250215

I'm not sure if this is relevant, but they all also show that the total virtual memory is 140 TB? Could it be trying to address memory that doesn't exist?

Any help would be appreciated.

title: Extensi√≥n para organizar marcadores por fecha de publicaci√≥n, duraci√≥n y carpeta en Firefox
content:
Saludos a todos. M√°s que una pregunta, es una solicitud de usuario de larga data de Firefox. El asunto es que me gustar√≠a que los desarrolladores de Firefox crearan una extensi√≥n de c√≥digo abierto y de m√≠nimo consumo para Firefox, que suministre los siguientes datos sobre los marcadores:

- Fecha de publicaci√≥n. - Duraci√≥n, si se trata de un v√≠deo proveniente de una plataforma de videos en internet como YouTube u Odysse. - Carpeta de alojamiento (Con su directorio) Y que el usuario pueda ordenar los marcadores dentro del navegador, seg√∫n esos datos. De la misma forma que ya se puede con "ordenar por nombre". Algo parecido a lo hacen los administradores o gestores de archivo como Nautilus o Explorador de Windows.

Muchas gracias.
